questions.text: An antiemetic was given to a chemotherapy patient, who then developed symptoms such as acute dystonia, bradykinesia, and tremors. Which of the following medications would have resulted in these symptoms? (NEET PG 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Metoclopramide

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Metoclopramide, an antiemetic that acts by blocking D2 receptors, can cause extrapyramidal symptoms such as acute dystonia, bradykinesia, and tremors.

questions.text: Coagulation profile monitoring is needed in therapy with which of the following drugs? (NEET PG 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Lepirudin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ :
  • ➤ Lepirudin, a direct thrombin inhibitor, requires regular monitoring of the activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) due to its potential for unpredictable anticoagulant effects and the risk of serious bleeding.

questions.text: Which of the following anticoagulant requires coagulation profile monitoring? ( INICET May 2024)
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Lepirudin

questions.text: A patient suffering from Bronchial asthma comes to you in hospital. All of the following drugs are used in acute exacerbation; EXCEPT: (Fmge June 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D. Leukotriene antagonist

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Leukotriene antagonists are not typically used in the acute management of asthma exacerbations but are instead used as long-term controller medications.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a prokinetic? (NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Diphenylmethane

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Diphenylmethane is not a prokinetic drug and is not used to treat gastrointestinal motility disorders. Prokinetic drugs include 5HT4 agonists, dopamine antagonists, and macrolides, which all act to enhance gastrointestinal motility.

questions.text: What is the mechanism of action of Oseltamivir and zanamivir? (NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Neuraminidase inhibition

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Oseltamivir and zanamivir are neuraminidase inhibitors used to treat influenza. By inhibiting the neuraminidase enzyme, these drugs prevent the release of new viral particles from infected cells, limiting the spread of the virus within the host.

questions.text: A female patient has been receiving first-line pharmacological treatment for bipolar disorder for 6 months. She is fasting for religious reasons and is experiencing seizures, coarse tremors, confusion, and limb weakness. Which of the following tests should be performed to help diagnose her condition? (NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Serum lithium level

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Serum lithium level should be checked in a patient receiving lithium therapy for bipolar disorder who presents with symptoms such as seizures, coarse tremors, confusion, and limb weakness, especially in the context of fasting or dehydration. This is crucial to diagnosing and managing lithium toxicity.

questions.text: DNA-Protein interactions can be studied by using: (INICET MAY 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) DNA footprinting

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ DNA footprinting is the appropriate method for studying DNA-Protein interactions, as it allows researchers to identify the specific binding sites of proteins on DNA by selectively cleaving or modifying the DNA sequence. This technique is fundamental for understanding how proteins interact with DNA in various biological processes.

References:

  • ↳ Reference: Harper’s 31 st ed/pg- 451

questions.text: A chronic alcoholic patient with alcoholic liver disease was given metronidazole for an infection. The next day, the patient presented with confusion, hallucinations, tremors, and agitation. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Delirium tremens

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Delirium tremens is a severe form of alcohol withdrawal that typically occurs 48–96 hours after the last alcohol intake. It is characterized by confusion, tremors, hallucinations, agitation, and autonomic hyperactivity . The patient’s chronic alcoholism and abrupt discontinuation (or reduced intake) of alcohol likely triggered the condition, exacerbated by the stress of the underlying illness and treatment.
  • • characterized by confusion, tremors, hallucinations, agitation, and autonomic hyperactivity
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option B. Psychosis: Although alcohol-related psychosis can occur, the hallmark features of delirium tremens (hallucinations, agitation, tremors) align more closely with this scenario.
  • • Option B. Psychosis:
  • • Option C. Disulfiram-like reaction: This condition, caused by the accumulation of acetaldehyde due to inhibition of acetaldehyde dehydrogenase (e.g., by metronidazole), typically results in nausea, vomiting, flushing, and hypotension, not confusion and hallucinations .
  • • Option C. Disulfiram-like reaction:
  • • typically results in nausea, vomiting, flushing, and hypotension, not confusion and hallucinations
  • • Option D. Alcohol withdrawal: While alcohol withdrawal can present with symptoms like nausea, anxiety, and tremors, delirium tremens represents a severe progression of this spectrum.
  • • Option D. Alcohol withdrawal:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Delirium tremens is a life-threatening complication of alcohol withdrawal, presenting with hallucinations, confusion, and agitation, typically within 48–96 hours of reduced alcohol intake. Early recognition and management are critical to prevent fatal outcomes.

questions.text: A patient who has just recovered from COVID-19 infection visits your OPD with black discoloration material in nose and posterior part of buccal cavity. He also gives history of using high dose steroid therapy during his treatment of COVID-19. Which of the following is most suitable drug for his treatment? (Fmge June 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Amphotericin B

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The drug of choice for treating mucormycosis, especially in patients who have received high-dose steroid therapy following COVID-19, is Amphotericin B. Mucormycosis presents with black necrotic lesions, hence the name "black fungus." Other effective drugs for mucormycosis include Posaconazole and Isavuconazole.

questions.text: A patient of colorectal cancer was treated with folinic acid, 5-fluorouracil and irinotecan therapy. He developed diarrhea following the regimen. Which of the following drug can be used for treatment of chemotherapy related diarrhea in this patient? (Fmge Jan 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Loperamide

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Option D. Metronidazole
  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For the treatment of chemotherapy-induced diarrhea, particularly following regimens that include drugs like irinotecan, loperamide is the appropriate choice. Loperamide effectively reduces intestinal motility and secretions, helping to control and reduce diarrhea. Other medications such as ciprofloxacin and metronidazole are used for infectious causes of diarrhea and are not suitable for chemotherapy-induced cases.

questions.text: A patient with gout develops hypertension. The uric acid level was found to be elevated. Which of the following is not administered? (NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Hydrochlorothiazide

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hydrochlorothiazide should not be used to manage hypertension in patients with gout due to its potential to increase uric acid levels and exacerbate the condition. Other antihypertensive drugs, such as beta-blockers (atenolol), ACE inhibitors (enalapril), and alpha-blockers (prazosin), do not have this adverse effect and are suitable alternatives.

questions.text: As an Indian medical intern, which of the following is the correct format for prescription of alprazolam? (NEET PG 2021)

options.label: A
options.text: Tablet alprazolam 0.5 mg once a day before bedtime for 7 days

options.label: B
options.text: Tablet alprazolam 0.5 mg HS for 7 days

options.label: C
options.text: Tablet alprazolam 500 mcg one tablet OD for 7 days

options.label: D
options.text: Tablet alprazolam ½ mg tablet HS daily

questions.correct_answer: A. Tablet alprazolam 0.5 mg once a day before bedtime for 7 days
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Tablet alprazolam 0.5 mg once a day before bedtime for 7 days

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ When writing a prescription, always avoid abbreviations for dosage instructions, use clear and complete language, include leading zeros for dosages less than one, and avoid trailing zeros. The correct format ensures clarity and safety for the patient.

questions.text: A 62-year-old woman presents to the clinic for her annual check-up. Her DEXA scan shows evidence of osteoporosis with a T-score of -3.0 at the lumbar spine. She is postmenopausal and has no other significant medical history. She is interested in pharmacological treatment options for her osteoporosis. What is the first-line management for postmenopausal osteoporosis in this patient? (NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Bisphosphonates

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Bisphosphonates are the first-line management for postmenopausal osteoporosis due to their effectiveness in inhibiting bone resorption and reducing fracture risk. Estrogen and raloxifene are alternative options but are not typically first-line treatments due to their associated risks and less robust efficacy compared to bisphosphonates. Combined oral contraceptives are not suitable for postmenopausal osteoporosis treatment.

questions.text: Which of the following is/are adverse effect of SGLT2 inhibitors? (AIIMS MAY 2019) 1. Ketoacidosis 2. Urosepsis 3. Fournier’s gangrene 4. Angioedema
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. 1, 2 and 3 are correct

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The primary adverse effects of SGLT2 inhibitors include ketoacidosis, urosepsis, and Fournier's gangrene, while angioedema is not associated with these medications.

References:

  • ↳ Reference: - KDT 8 TH /301

questions.text: A psychiatric patient was started on lithium for the management of bipolar disorder. To monitor the blood lithium levels, at what time interval should the blood sample be collected after the administration of lithium tablets? (AIIMS MAY 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. After 12 hours

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ To monitor lithium levels accurately and ensure they remain within the therapeutic range, blood samples should be collected 12 hours after the last dose. This helps in avoiding toxicity and ensuring the efficacy of the treatment for bipolar disorder.

questions.text: Following a hysterectomy, the patient received morphine for pain management both during the post-operative period and while in the ward. The current symptoms include respiratory depression and constricted (pinpoint) pupils. What would be the recommended medication for this patient? ( INICET MAY 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C. Naloxone

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Naloxone is the drug of choice for treating acute opioid overdose, characterized by symptoms such as respiratory depression, pinpoint pupils, and coma. It acts rapidly to reverse the effects of opioids by competitively inhibiting their action at opioid receptors.

questions.text: An individual with type 2 diabetes mellitus was prescribed a medication that lowered their HbA1C levels from 7.6 to 6.7. Subsequently, the person began experiencing discomfort characterized by itching in the vulvovaginal region. What is the probable medication that was initiated for this individual? (INICET May 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Canagliflozin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Canagliflozin is an SGLT2 inhibitor that lowers blood sugar by causing more glucose to be excreted in the urine. It is known for causing genitourinary infections, including vulvovaginal candidiasis, which can result in symptoms like itching and discomfort.
  • ➤ Canagliflozin

questions.text: Name the drug that acts on both the marked points: (NEET PG 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Omapatrilat

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Omapatrilat inhibits both neprilysin and angiotensin-converting enzyme, thereby decreasing angiotensin II and increasing natriuretic peptides, promoting natriuresis, diuresis, and vasodilation.

questions.text: Identify the best parameter to assess in case of male infertility? (AIIMS NOV 2017)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) The morphology of sperms

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The morphology of sperms is considered the best parameter to assess male infertility. Sperm morphology refers to the size and shape of sperm, and abnormalities in these characteristics can significantly affect a man's fertility.
  • • Key Points:
  • • Key Points:
  • • Sperm Morphology: Characterization of normal sperm morphology shows improved correlation with fertilization rates during IVF cycles. A significantly decreased fertilization rate is observed when the normal morphology of the sample falls below the strict criteria of 4%. Sperm Quantity and Number: While the quantity and number of sperms are important, they are not as critical as morphology in determining fertility potential. Sperm Motility: Motility is also a crucial factor, but morphology has a stronger correlation with fertilization success.
  • • Sperm Morphology: Characterization of normal sperm morphology shows improved correlation with fertilization rates during IVF cycles. A significantly decreased fertilization rate is observed when the normal morphology of the sample falls below the strict criteria of 4%.
  • • Sperm Morphology:
  • • Sperm Quantity and Number: While the quantity and number of sperms are important, they are not as critical as morphology in determining fertility potential.
  • • Sperm Quantity and Number:
  • • Sperm Motility: Motility is also a crucial factor, but morphology has a stronger correlation with fertilization success.
  • • Sperm Motility:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. The quantity of sperms: Refers to the total volume of ejaculate, which is less indicative of fertility compared to morphology.
  • • Option A. The quantity of sperms:
  • • Option B. The motility of sperms: Important for fertility but not as strongly correlated with fertilization success as morphology.
  • • Option B. The motility of sperms:
  • • Option D. The number of sperm: Similar to the quantity, the number is important but does not correlate as closely with fertilization rates as morphology does.
  • • Option D. The number of sperm:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Sperm morphology is the most significant parameter for assessing male infertility, as it closely correlates with fertilization rates during assisted reproductive techniques like IVF.

questions.text: Which of the following drugs is used for the prophylaxis of motion sickness? (NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Promethazine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Promethazine is used for the prophylaxis of motion sickness due to its strong antihistamine, anticholinergic, sedative, and antiemetic properties. Second-generation antihistamines like cetirizine, misolastine, and loratadine are not effective for this purpose due to their lack of these properties.

questions.text: A patient on aspirin presented with occult blood in the stool. This is due to inhibition of_____ by aspirin? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Thromboxane Synthesis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Aspirin inhibits thromboxane synthesis by irreversibly inhibiting cyclooxygenase enzymes (COX-1 and COX-2), leading to reduced platelet aggregation and an increased risk of gastrointestinal bleeding.

questions.text: Which of the following antibiotics is primarily excreted via bile and is safe for use in patients with renal failure?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Ceftriaxone

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Ceftriaxone is primarily excreted via bile and does not require significant dose adjustment in patients with renal failure. This makes it safer for use in such patients compared to other antibiotics that are primarily cleared by the kidneys.
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. Gentamicin: Gentamicin is an aminoglycoside that is primarily excreted by the kidneys and requires dose adjustments in renal failure to prevent nephrotoxicity and ototoxicity.
  • • Option A. Gentamicin:
  • • Option C. Amphotericin B: Although amphotericin B is not significantly renally excreted, it can cause nephrotoxicity, requiring careful monitoring and possible dose adjustments based on renal function.
  • • Option C. Amphotericin B:
  • • Option D. Vancomycin: Vancomycin is predominantly renally excreted, and its dose must be adjusted in renal failure to avoid toxicity.
  • • Option D. Vancomycin:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The drugs which are secreted in bile and safe in renal disease include:
  • ➤ The drugs which are secreted in bile and safe in renal disease include:
  • ➤ Cef in: Cefoperazone, Ceftriaxone
  • ➤ The: Tigecycline
  • ➤ R: Rifampicin
  • ➤ E: Erythromycin
  • ➤ N: Nafcillin
  • ➤ A: Ampicillin
  • ➤ L: Lincosamide (Clindamycin)
  • ➤ D: Doxycycline

questions.text: The replacement dose of hydrocortisone for adrenal insufficiency is: (NEET PG 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 15-25

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The standard replacement dose of hydrocortisone for adrenal insufficiency is 15-25 mg per day, divided into two or three doses to mimic the body's natural cortisol production. This dose may be adjusted based on individual patient needs and response to treatment.

questions.text: A 45-year-old male with a history of recurrent skin infections is admitted to the hospital for cellulitis. He has been treated with penicillin in the past but his current infection is not responding well to the treatment. The healthcare team suspects that the infecting bacteria may produce beta-lactamases and are considering alternative antibiotics. What is the mechanism of resistance by beta-lactamases to penicillins? (NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Degradation of antibiotics.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Beta-lactamases confer resistance to penicillins by enzymatically degrading the beta-lactam ring of the antibiotic, rendering it inactive. This is the primary mechanism by which beta-lactamase-producing bacteria evade the effects of beta-lactam antibiotics.

questions.text: Most effective antiemetic for chemotherapy-induced vomiting is: (NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Granisetron

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Granisetron, a 5-HT3 receptor antagonist, is the most effective antiemetic for preventing chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting (CINV). It is the standard of care for managing nausea and vomiting associated with moderate to highly emetogenic chemotherapy agents.

questions.text: An anticancer drug, 5-Fluorouracil, causes thymineless death of cells. Which type of enzyme inhibition is responsible for this mechanism of action of 5-Fluorouracil? (FMGE July 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Competitive

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ 5-Fluorouracil causes thymineless death of cancer cells through competitive inhibition of thymidylate synthase, blocking thymidine synthesis necessary for DNA replication in rapidly dividing cells.

questions.text: Which of the following is a second line anti-tubercular drug? ( INICET May 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Ethionamide

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ethionamide is a second-line anti-tubercular drug used in the management of multidrug-resistant tuberculosis (MDR-TB), whereas isoniazid is a first-line drug, and acyclovir and vancomycin are not used for tuberculosis treatment.

questions.text: Which is the drug used for refractory intractable rheumatic chorea? (NEET PG 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Sodium valproate

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Sodium valproate is the preferred drug for treating refractory intractable rheumatic chorea due to its efficacy in reducing involuntary movements by enhancing inhibitory neurotransmission in the brain. It has a better side effect profile for long-term management of this condition compared to other options.

questions.text: A male patient is being treated for a mood disorder. After starting a new medication, he experiences priapism, a prolonged, painful erection. The healthcare provider is considering changing the medication. Which drug is most likely responsible for causing priapism in this patient? (INICET MAY 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Trazodone

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Trazodone is the most likely antidepressant to cause priapism among the listed options due to its known side effect profile. This serious condition necessitates careful monitoring and potentially switching medications to prevent recurrence.

questions.text: The given diagram shows the steps in bacterial cell wall formation. Identify the site of action of beta-lactam antibiotics. (INICET MAY 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D. 4

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Beta-lactam antibiotics act at step 4 in the bacterial cell wall synthesis process by inhibiting transpeptidase enzymes, which are essential for cross-linking peptidoglycan chains, thereby weakening the bacterial cell wall and causing cell lysis.

questions.text: A patient is undergoing treatment for cancer with methotrexate. What is the mechanism of action? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Inhibits dihydrofolic acid reductase

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Methotrexate is an antimetabolite drug that inhibits dihydrofolic acid reductase, an enzyme crucial for DNA synthesis. This mechanism disrupts cell division, making it effective in treating cancer.

questions.text: A young boy with a history of multiple blood transfusions presents with bone pain for the past 6 months. A peripheral smear showed sickle-shaped RBCs. Which of the following drugs are not used in the treatment of his condition? (INICET MAY 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Bebtelovimab

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Bebtelovimab is not used in the treatment of sickle cell anemia; it is a monoclonal antibody used for COVID-19 treatment. In contrast, Voxelotor, Hydroxyurea, and L-glutamine are used in managing sickle cell anemia by improving hemoglobin function and reducing oxidative stress in red blood cells.

questions.text: A patient aged 45 years presents with swelling in MCP joints and his serum uric acid levels were found to be elevated. His physician prescribed a drug which is considered as the first line agent in the management of this condition. What is the mechanism of this drug? (Fmge June 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Xanthine oxidase inhibitor

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Allopurinol, a xanthine oxidase inhibitor, is the first-line agent for lowering urate levels in the management of gout.

questions.text: A female patient presented with pain and redness in great toe. Serum uric acid level is 9.6 mg/dL. Apart from prescribing analgesics for relieving pain, the physician prescribed a drug which can decrease the formation of uric acid. Which of the following enzyme is likely to be inhibited by this drug? (Fmge Jan 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Xanthine oxidase

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Xanthine oxidase is the enzyme responsible for the final steps in the production of uric acid from purines. Inhibitors of xanthine oxidase, such as allopurinol and febuxostat, are used to reduce uric acid levels and are effective treatments for hyperuricemia and gout.

questions.text: A man was brought to the emergency room after poisoning with an unknown substance. Muscarinic poisoning was suspected and he was treated for the same. What is the possible presenting feature which led to the diagnosis? (INICET MAY 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D. Bradycardia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Bradycardia is a key presenting feature that can lead to the diagnosis of muscarinic poisoning. Muscarinic receptors, particularly M2 receptors in the heart, mediate a decrease in heart rate. Atropine is used to manage muscarinic poisoning by blocking acetylcholine's action on these receptors.

questions.text: A 35-year-old patient with a history of bipolar disorder has recently been started on lithium therapy. During a follow-up visit, the healthcare provider wants to educate the patient on the signs of lithium toxicity. Which of the following side effects should the patient be instructed to monitor and report immediately as they may indicate lithium toxicity? (AIIMS MAY 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Ataxia and Diarrhea

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Patients on lithium therapy should be educated to monitor and immediately report signs of lithium toxicity, such as ataxia and diarrhea, to prevent serious adverse effects.
  • ➤ Mnemonic
  • ➤ Mnemonic
  • ➤ If DAT symptom is present, report to hospital:
  • ➤ DAT
  • ➤ D iarrhea A taxia T innitus
  • ➤ D iarrhea
  • ➤ D
  • ➤ A taxia
  • ➤ A
  • ➤ T innitus
  • ➤ T

questions.text: A young female is brought to the emergency department. Attendants inform that she has consumed 100 tablets of aspirin. What should be the next step in management? (NEET PG 2023)

options.label: A
options.text: N-acetyl cysteine to replenish glutathione stores

options.label: C
options.text: Glucagon to control bradycardia and hypoglycemia

options.label: D
options.text: Give sodium bicarbonate to alkalize urine

questions.correct_answer: D. Give sodium bicarbonate to alkalize urine
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Give sodium bicarbonate to alkalize urine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Sodium Bicarbonate is the treatment of choice in aspirin poisoning, as it helps to alkalize the urine and enhance the excretion of salicylates, while also correcting metabolic acidosis.
  • ➤ Sodium Bicarbonate

questions.text: Which of the following anti-tubercular drug is not bactericidal? ( INICET May 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C. Thioacetazone

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Thioacetazone is a bacteriostatic anti-tubercular drug, which means it inhibits bacterial growth rather than killing the bacteria outright. In contrast, isoniazid, rifapentin, and kanamycin are all bactericidal drugs used in the treatment of tuberculosis.

questions.text: Which of the following can be prescribed in case of an open angle glaucoma with bronchial asthma? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Latanoprost

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Latanoprost, a prostaglandin F2α analog, is safe and effective for the treatment of open-angle glaucoma in patients with bronchial asthma, as it does not cause bronchospasm.

questions.text: The Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine, 2018 was awarded to James P. Allison and Tasuku Honjo for which of the following discoveries? (AIIMS NOV 2018)

options.label: B
options.text: Discoveries of molecular mechanisms controlling the circadian rhythm

options.label: C
options.text: Discovery of cancer therapy by inhibition of negative immune regulation

options.label: D
options.text: Discovery that mature cells can be reprogrammed to become pluripotent

questions.correct_answer: C. Discovery of cancer therapy by inhibition of negative immune regulation
questions.explanation:
Ans. C.  Discovery of cancer therapy by inhibition of negative immune regulation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Immune checkpoint inhibitors function by blocking the proteins that control the immune system's reactions to cancer cells. The immune system's brake is removed when these proteins are inhibited, making it easier for T cells to more efficiently eliminate cancer cells.
  • ➤ James P. Allison and Tasuku Honjo were awarded the 2018 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for their discovery of cancer therapy through inhibition of negative immune regulation.

questions.text: Which of the following is the drug of choice for scrub typhus? (NEET PG 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Doxycycline

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Doxycycline is the drug of choice for scrub typhus due to its high efficacy in treating this rickettsial infection. Azithromycin and chloramphenicol can be used as alternatives in cases where doxycycline is contraindicated, such as during pregnancy.

questions.text: An elderly man with diabetic nephropathy presented to the emergency department with palpitations and chest discomfort. The ECG revealed large T-waves. Laboratory tests revealed elevated potassium levels. Which of the following drugs can cause intracellular movement of potassium? (NEET PG 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Epinephrine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Beta-2 agonists, such as Epinephrine, are effective in promoting the intracellular movement of potassium, thereby reducing serum potassium levels in cases of hyperkalemia.

questions.text: Mention the true statement/s about digoxin toxicity:(AIIMS MAY 2019) Earliest manifestation of digoxin toxicity is gastrointestinal symptoms Nonspecific vision changes may be noted in digoxin toxicity Early toxicity may not correlate with serum levels Neurological symptoms may occur without corresponding cardiovascular changes Hypokalemia is associated with increased risk of toxicity
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. All are true

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ All statements about digoxin toxicity, including the earliest manifestations, vision changes, correlation with serum levels, neurological symptoms, and the association with hypokalemia, are true.

References:

  • ↳ Reference: - KDT 8 TH /560

questions.text: A 45-year-old patient presents with widespread purpura and easy bruising. Laboratory tests reveal a significantly low platelet count with normal hemoglobin and white blood cell count, indicating a diagnosis of isolated thrombocytopenia. The patient has no prior history of autoimmune disorders or recent viral infections. Considering these symptoms and diagnosis, which tyrosine kinase inhibitor would be appropriate for this patient? (INICET NOV 2023)
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Fostamatinib is a tyrosine kinase inhibitor specifically used for treating chronic immune thrombocytopenia (ITP) by inhibiting spleen tyrosine kinase (Syk) to reduce platelet destruction and increase platelet count.

questions.text: Which of the following is the most appropriate treatment for an overactive bladder in a patient with dementia to minimize the risk of cognitive decline?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Mirabegron

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Mirabegron is a beta-3 adrenergic agonist that relaxes the detrusor muscle in the bladder during the storage phase, thereby reducing symptoms of overactive bladder (OAB) such as urgency, frequency, and incontinence. Unlike anticholinergic drugs, it does not interfere with acetylcholine pathways and therefore has a lower risk of exacerbating cognitive decline in patients with dementia. This makes mirabegron the preferred choice for managing OAB in such patients.
  • • Most appropriate treatment for an overactive bladder in a patient with dementia:
  • • Most appropriate treatment for an overactive bladder in a patient with dementia:
  • • Mirabegron >> Trospium (as it has minimal CNS entry) >> Tolterodine
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. Tolterodine: Tolterodine is an anticholinergic drug commonly used for OAB but has potential side effects of cognitive decline, especially in dementia patients, due to its effects on central muscarinic receptors.
  • • Option A. Tolterodine:
  • • Option C. Trospium: Trospium is an anticholinergic with minimal CNS penetration, making it a safer alternative to other anticholinergics for dementia patients. However, it is less effective than mirabegron in avoiding cognitive side effects.
  • • Option C. Trospium:
  • • Option D. Tiotropium: Tiotropium is an anticholinergic used for chronic respiratory conditions like COPD and asthma, not for OAB.
  • • Option D. Tiotropium:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Mirabegron is the preferred treatment for overactive bladder in patients with dementia due to its lack of anticholinergic effects and reduced risk of cognitive impairment. In cases where mirabegron is unavailable, trospium may be a safer alternative among anticholinergic options.

questions.text: A pituitary tumor that overproduced growth hormone was surgically removed from a patient. The resection was discovered to be insufficient. What is the patient's first-line treatment? (NEET PG 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Octreotide

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Octreotide is used for the treatment of the following conditions: ( SOMAT ostatin)
  • ➤ Octreotide is used for the treatment of the following conditions: ( SOMAT ostatin)
  • ➤ SOMAT
  • ➤ S: S ecretory diarrhea due to carcinoid tumor, VIPomas, following cancer chemotherapy, AIDS etc.
  • ➤ S: S
  • ➤ O: O esophageal varices (Acute Variceal bleeding)
  • ➤ O: O
  • ➤ M: M alignancy like Insulinoma and Glucagonoma
  • ➤ M: M
  • ➤ A: A cromegaly due to GH secreting pituitary adenoma
  • ➤ A: A
  • ➤ T: T hyrotrope adenoma
  • ➤ T: T
  • ➤ Leuprolide, Goeserelin and Nafarelin are GnRH agonists.
  • ➤ Leuprolide, Goeserelin and Nafarelin are GnRH agonists.

questions.text: Inhalational anaesthetic agent of choice in children is (INICET MAY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Sevoflurane

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In summary, sevoflurane is preferred for pediatric anesthesia due to its favorable profile, including rapid onset and recovery, minimal airway irritation, and a pleasant smell, making it well-tolerated by children.

questions.text: A pregnant woman was prescribed indomethacin. Which of the following effects does the drug have on the fetus? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.correct_answer: A. Premature closure of ductus arteriosus
questions.explanation:
Ans. A)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Indomethacin, an NSAID, can cause the premature closure of the ductus arteriosus in a fetus due to its inhibition of prostaglandin synthesis. Therefore, caution should be exercised when prescribing this drug to pregnant women, particularly in the third trimester.

questions.text: A patient was started on antihypertensive drugs. Few days later, the patient presented with the following picture. Which of the following drugs is the most likely cause? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Lisinopril

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Side effects of ACE-Inhibitors are:-
  • ➤ Side effects of ACE-Inhibitors are:-
  • ➤ Angioedema Cough Taste disturbances (Dysguesia) Orthostatic hypotension Hyperkalemia They are contraindicated in Pregnancy and in patients with B/L Renal artery stenosis.
  • ➤ Angioedema
  • ➤ Cough
  • ➤ Taste disturbances (Dysguesia)
  • ➤ Orthostatic hypotension
  • ➤ Hyperkalemia
  • ➤ They are contraindicated in Pregnancy and in patients with B/L Renal artery stenosis.

questions.text: Which one of the following drugs inhibits neutrophil recruitment? (NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Colchicine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Colchicine is the drug that inhibits neutrophil recruitment by disrupting microtubules, thus affecting neutrophil mobility and reducing inflammation. This mechanism makes it effective in treating conditions like gout and familial Mediterranean fever.

questions.text: The antiviral drug having dual antiviral activity against HIV and HBV is? (NEET PG 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Emtricitabine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Emtricitabine is an antiviral drug with dual activity against both HIV and HBV, making it a valuable component in the treatment of patients co-infected with these viruses. Other drugs with dual activity include lamivudine and tenofovir.

questions.text: Voriconazole is the drug of choice for which of the following fungal infections?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Aspergillosis

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Voriconazole is highly effective against Aspergillus species and is considered the drug of choice for invasive aspergillosis. It works by inhibiting fungal cytochrome P450 enzymes, thereby disrupting fungal cell membrane synthesis. Its broad-spectrum activity makes it useful for many fungal infections, but it has limited efficacy against some pathogens.
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. Mucormycosis: Voriconazole is ineffective against mucormycosis, caused by fungi in the order Mucorales. Amphotericin B or posaconazole is preferred for mucormycosis treatment.
  • • Option A. Mucormycosis:
  • • Option B. Candida krusei: While voriconazole is effective against many Candida species, it is not the drug of choice for Candida krusei, which often requires echinocandins like caspofungin.
  • • Option B. Candida krusei:
  • • Option D. Cryptococcus neoformans: Cryptococcus infections, particularly cryptococcal meningitis, are typically treated with amphotericin B and flucytosine, not voriconazole.
  • • Option D. Cryptococcus neoformans:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Voriconazole is the drug of choice for invasive aspergillosis due to its effectiveness against Aspergillus species. However, it is not suitable for mucormycosis and some other fungal infections, where alternative antifungal agents are required.

questions.text: A 60-year-old postmenopausal female patient with a history of Colle's fracture comes to the outpatient department complaining of lower back pain. After undergoing a bone density test, her T score is found to be -2.5. Which of the following statements about the management of her condition is incorrect? (NEET PG 2021)

options.label: A
options.text: Teriparatide should be started before supplementing with bisphosphonates

options.label: B
options.text: Bisphosphonates are not given for more than a year

options.label: C
options.text: Calcium requirement is 1200 mg per day

options.label: D
options.text: Oral vitamin D3 is given along with oral calcium

questions.correct_answer: B. Bisphosphonates are not given for more than a year
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Bisphosphonates are not given for more than a year

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Bisphosphonates are recommended for up to 5 years, not just one year, in the treatment of osteoporosis in postmenopausal women.

questions.text: A patient presents with hypertension. He has a history of renal stones and has experienced a few episodes of renal colic. Which diuretic is the most appropriate to use? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Hydrochlorothiazide

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hydrochlorothiazide is the preferred diuretic in patients with a history of renal stones because it reduces urinary calcium excretion, thereby decreasing the risk of stone formation.

questions.text: Which of the following fluoroquinolones has maximum bioavailability? (NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Levofloxacin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Levofloxacin has the highest bioavailability among the listed fluoroquinolones, with nearly 100% of the administered dose reaching systemic circulation. This high bioavailability makes levofloxacin highly effective for a wide range of bacterial infections.

questions.text: Which of the following adverse effect is least likely to be associated with the use of amiodarone? (Fmge Jan 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Gynecomastia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Gynecomastia is typically associated with drugs that affect hormonal balance. Drugs causing gynecomastia includes:
  • ➤ Drugs causing gynecomastia includes:
  • ➤ DI: DI goxin
  • ➤ DI: DI
  • ➤ S: S pironolactone
  • ➤ S: S
  • ➤ C: C imetidine
  • ➤ C: C
  • ➤ O: O estrogens
  • ➤ O: O

questions.text: A 58-year-old hypertensive patient with a history of myocardial infarction (MI) presents with an acute attack of migraine. Which of the following medications is the safest option for this patient?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Ibuprofen

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Ibuprofen, a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID), is a safe and effective option for managing mild to moderate migraine attacks in patients with a history of MI. It does not cause vasoconstriction and does not exacerbate cardiovascular conditions. As such, it is the safest option for acute migraine treatment in this patient.
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option B. Sumatriptan: Sumatriptan, a triptan, is contraindicated in patients with a history of MI due to its vasoconstrictive properties, which can lead to coronary artery spasm and worsen cardiac conditions.
  • • Option B. Sumatriptan:
  • • Option C. Ergotamine: Like sumatriptan, ergotamine induces vasoconstriction and carries a high risk of coronary artery spasm. It is contraindicated in patients with MI or significant cardiovascular disease.
  • • Option C. Ergotamine:
  • • Option D. Propranolol: While propranolol is commonly used as a prophylactic agent for migraines , it is not suitable for acute migraine treatment. It does not relieve the immediate symptoms of a migraine attack.
  • • Option D. Propranolol:
  • • prophylactic agent for migraines

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In patients with a history of myocardial infarction or cardiovascular disease, NSAIDs like ibuprofen are the safest option for treating acute migraine attacks. Triptans and ergot derivatives should be avoided due to their vasoconstrictive effects, which can exacerbate cardiac conditions.

questions.text: A patient was given 0.5% bupivacaine for brachial plexus block. After some time, the patient developed hypotension and cardiovascular collapse. What is the best treatment for this patient? (Fmge Jan 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D. 20% Intralipid

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Intralipid therapy is the recommended treatment for severe local anesthetic systemic toxicity (LAST), which can occur with medications like bupivacaine. It acts by trapping lipophilic drugs like bupivacaine in an intravascular lipid emulsion, reducing their toxicity.

questions.text: An elderly woman received a Botox injection for the treatment of wrinkles. Which of the following is the mechanism of action of botulinum toxin? (NEET PG 2022)

options.label: B
options.text: Release of noradrenaline at synaptic cleft

options.label: C
options.text: Selectively and irreversibly inhibits nicotinic receptors

questions.correct_answer: A. Inhibits the release of acetylcholine
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Inhibits the release of acetylcholine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Botulinum toxin inhibits the release of acetylcholine by cleaving SNARE proteins, thereby preventing neurotransmission at the neuromuscular junction and leading to muscle relaxation.
